summary: Bug fix verification complete for 6 broken pages from iteration 95. Fixed Timesheets.js crash caused by API returning array instead of object. All 6 pages now render correctly without crashes.
critical_code_review_comments: Minor: Console shows HTML hydration warnings about <span> inside <tbody>/<tr> - these are React DevTools artifacts and don't affect functionality
Minor: LeaveManagement shows 'Each child in a list should have a unique key prop' warning - suggest filtering items without id like MyLeaves does
updated_files: /app/frontend/src/pages/Timesheets.js - Fixed lines 55-63: Handle API returning array instead of object for timesheetRes.data
context_for_next_testing_agent: All 6 previously broken pages now work. Fixed Timesheets.js crash - the /api/timesheets endpoint returns an array of timesheet objects, but the code was trying to access .entries property on the array (which returns Array.prototype.entries function, not undefined, causing Object.values to fail). Fix: Check if response is array and extract first element before accessing .entries property.

pages_status./my-leaves: WORKING - Leave balance cards and requests table display correctly, filter(req => req.id) working
pages_status./my-details: WORKING - Profile sections (Personal, Contact, Address, Bank, Employment) all render
pages_status./leave-management: WORKING - Statistics and leave requests table with tabs display correctly
pages_status./timesheets: WORKING - Week navigation, time entries grid, empty state all render (FIXED THIS ITERATION)
pages_status./team-performance: WORKING - Shows proper empty state 'No team members assigned to you yet'
pages_status./meetings: WORKING - Shows meetings list with existing meeting data

fixes_applied.change: Handle API returning array: Extract first element from array before accessing .entries/.status/.notes properties
fixes_applied.root_cause: The /api/timesheets endpoint returns an array of timesheet objects, but code assumed single object. Array.entries is a function, so timesheetData became a function instead of an object, causing Object.values() to crash.

rca_of_the_issue: Timesheets page crash: The backend /api/timesheets endpoint returns an array of timesheet records (e.g., [{entries: {}, status: 'draft', ...}]). The frontend code was directly accessing timesheetRes.data.entries which on an array returns Array.prototype.entries (a function). When this function was passed to Object.values() in getTotalForDay/getWeekTotal, it threw 'Cannot convert undefined or null to object' error. Fix: Added Array.isArray check to extract first element before accessing properties.
